meanings.definition: To strike with a resounding blow or slap.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally whops his hand on the table.
meanings.sent2: She whops the ball with her racket during the game.
meanings.sent3: The clown whops his own head for a silly trick.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm whops the windows with raindrops.
meanings.sent5: The chef whops the dough to make it smooth and even.

meanings.sent1: The whops of the fireworks echoed through the night.
meanings.sent2: The sudden whops startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent3: The whops of the falling books made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The whops of the drum added rhythm to the music.
meanings.sent5: The whops of the hammer signaled the start of construction.
